Key Match Events: Aaron Jones and Andries Gous made a 131-run partnership at a run rate of 14.29, the highest run-rate for any century partnership at the T20 World Cup.
Aaron Jones finished with ten sixes, sealing USA's victory by seven wickets and 14 balls to spare.
Post-Match Reflections: USA captain Monank Patel praised the team's effort and mentioned the importance of Gous and Jones handling the pressure situation.
Canada captain Saad Bin Zafar acknowledged the strong batting performance of Jones and Gous and mentioned the mistakes in fielding and bowling.
Aaron Jones expressed happiness for taking the team over the line and mentioned the support from the crowd.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch had good bounce and got better for batting in the second innings with dew settling in.
Canada's bowlers missed their lines and lengths, and they gave away no-balls and extras.
USA won by 7 wickets with 14 balls remaining.
